intro: Lathyrus magellanicus var. longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed grass vetch, is a perennial legume native to South America. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. The plant produces elongated, cylindrical pods that contain several seeds, typical of the Fabaceae family. It thrives in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and sandy soils. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and potential agricultural use.
